title: Tarique Rahman to lead the country with a new vision: Mirza Abbas
body: BNP Standing Committee member Mirza Abbas today announced that the party's acting chairman, Tarique Rahman, will soon return to the country and take charge of the party. "Our leader, Tarique Rahman, will return soon, take charge of the people and politics, and lead the country forward with new ideas and vision. This is my hope," he said at a programme this morning. He made the remarks during the opening speech at a discussion organised by BNP, titled "Plan to Build the Country" at the Krishibid Institution Bangladesh (KIB) auditorium in Dhaka's Farmgate. Mirza Abbas said, "According to today's reports in the newspapers, her [Khaleda Zia's] condition is stable, meaning it hasn't worsened. We pray to Almighty Allah that her condition remains stable and improves further." "We truly need her. At this critical time, for the nation, Begum Khaleda Zia is vital to all political parties." At the event, Mirza Abbas said, "Recently, I spoke with a group of young members from another political group. I asked them if they would join us for the election." "They said they would, but only under certain conditions. They've stated they'll join if their reform demands are met." "I don't understand what they mean by reforms. I wanted to ask them what kind of reforms they are referring to. I wanted to know exactly what reforms they are talking about, but they couldn't explain."
